dmca.title: [ABUSE] Notice of Infringment - www.macupdate.com
dmca.body:
Macrovision strongly believes that the website www.macupdate.com
<http://www.macupdate.com/>  is infringing on Macrovision's proprietary
intellectual property and is willing to provide additional specific
information.

 

Identification of Copyright Material Infringed Upon:  Macrovision's
analog copy protection (anticopying) technology and Ripguard program are
outlined in the following patent claims: claims 14-20 of U.S. Patent No.
4,631,603, claims 9-13 of U.S. Patent No. 4,819,098, claims 18-29, 32,
33, 44-52 of U.S. Patent No. 4,907,093, claims 1-4, 6-10, 20 of U.S.
Patent No. 5,315,448, claim 29 of U.S. Patent No. 6,516,132, foreign
counterparts thereof having a first filing date prior to April 14, 2007,
as well as all reissues, continuations, continuations-in-part,
divisions, patents of improvement, patents of addition, and inventor
certificates thereof, and all patent applications for related
improvements filed prior to April 14, 2007.

 

Identification of Infringing Material:
http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414
<http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414> .  The webpage provides
MacTheRipper 2.6.6, a software which is described by the webpage as
removing "Macrovision protection".  Additionally, the screenshot of the
software includes the "De-Macrovision" button.

 

No Authorization:  The website
(http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414
<http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414> ) clearly provides for the
removal of Macrovision technology.  Macrovision does not license the
removal of its technology, and any website that offers or provides for
such removal (or offers products with the technology removed) infringes
Macrovision's intellectual property.  Further, any such website also
violates the Digital Millenium Copyright Act (a US Federal law) and the
Copyright Directive in the European Union.

 

In simpler language, the website provides a "Download Now" link to
software to remove Macrovision copy protection technology.
Additionally, the website specifically infringes through its use of the
"Macrovision" trademark.

 

Any disclaimer by macupdate that it is not advocating violation of the
law in no way immunizes its conduct.

 

Personal Statement: I, the undersigned, CERTIFY UNDER PENALTY OF PERJURY
that I am the owner or an agent authorized to act on behalf of the owner
of certain intellectual property rights, said owner being named
Macrovision Corporation ("IP Owner").  I have a good faith belief that
the listings or materials listed herein are not authorized by the above
IP Owner, its agent, or the law and therefore infringe the IP Owner's
rights according to state, federal, or United States law.

 

Acceptable Use Policy (AUP): Macrovision believes that these website
pages directly violate The Planet's own "Acceptable Use Policy (AUP)",
specifically: 

 

Compliance with Law - Customer shall not post, transmit, re-transmit or
store material on or through any of Services or Products which, in the
sole judgment of the Company . . . (iii) violates the rights of any
person, including rights protected by copyright, trade secret, patent or
other intellectual property or similar laws or regulations including,
but not limited to, the installation or distribution of "pirated" or
other software products that are not appropriately licensed for use by
Customer.

 

Copyright Infringement - Company datacenter infrastructure including
network, leased hardware, co-location services, and other hardware
located in the facility may only be used for lawful purposes.
Transmission, distribution, or storage of any information, data or
material in violation of United States or state regulation or law, or by
the common law, is prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to,
material protected by copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other
intellectual property rights; including creating, utilizing,
distributing unauthorized copies of software, or the use of BitTorrent
or other types of technologies utilized in the distribution of illegally
copied materials.  If Customer copies, distributes or installs software
in defiance of the license agreement, Customer is violating federal
copyright law. Company will cooperate with all law enforcement agencies
in relation to alleged copyright infringement housed in our datacenters.

 

Macrovision would accept the closing of the webpage
(http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414
<http://www.macupdate.com/info.php/id/14414> ), and does not require the
closing of the entire www.macupdate.com <http://www.macupdate.com/>
website.  

 

Please act immediately and confirm to me in writing that you have done
so.  If you have any questions, please contact me at
cmacinnes@macrovision.com <mailto:cmacinnes@macrovision.com>  or call me
at (408) 562-8466.

 

 

Regards, Campbell

 

Campbell MacInnes
